table_caption: Longitudinal statistical parametric mapping (SPM) demonstrated differences in the linear time dependence of fractional anisotropy (FA), axial diffusivity (AD), radial diffusivity (RD), and mean diffusivity (MD) maps between trainees and untrained subjects. To compare the differences at day 84 between trained and non-trained subjects, as well as the difference between days 28 and 84 for the trained subjects, the mean cluster of the linear changes was extracted and analyzed using Welch’s t-test and Bayesian statistics. The Bayes factor (BF01) is reported, where a value >1 indicates a preference for the null (H0) hypothesis. R = right, L = left.
